headline: 3 Beaten-Down Stocks That Are Trading Below Their Book Values
summary: A company's book value is equal to its total assets, less its liabilities.  Book value does not consider the future at all.  For investors, deals can be had when an otherwise solid company has stock trading below its book value per share (BVPS).
